title: Contesting Chat Restriction
body:
The Hecarim and Nasus who reported me were a duo queue pair, they had camped me and flamed me during the previous game, so I had a bad game. In the next game, I was on the same team as them, I called top and locked my champion, and then Nasus said he was going top because of how bad I was last game and he wouldn't allow me to top. We ended up duo top lane because neither of us would budge. The entirety of the lane phase consisted of me trying to 1v2 the lane because Nasus refused to do anything btu last hit minions, and outright walked away from ganks or fights and laughed. He said, "you're not my team mate and I only help team mates" In response to me asking why he wasn't helping me. Then when I accused him of outright refusing to assist me in any way, he responded with " Yep, that's what i'm trying to do" outright admitting that was his intent.

I feel like I dealt with this situation pretty fairly considering the circumstances, and they reported me for simply going top, because they were a duo queue reporting, I was instantly chat restricted. This seems highly unfair and a serious problem with the report system that 2 people can report and have a player instantly restricted. Ideally i'd like my restriction removed as I don't feel it's deserved, however If that's not possible some feedback on where I went wrong would be helpful, thanks in advance. 

Here is a copy of the restriction message.

I understand that towards the end of the game I was a bit sarcastic in my remarks, but understand that this is an entire game of frustration and I still feel like it wasn't outright rude or hateful what I said, the Nasus and Hecarim's comments are FAR more disgusting, however I can't view them to post them.

replies.body: This was the only game provided?
Yes sir, only game provided. Only game i've really got into it with someone as well.

Sadly, Riot absolutely LOVES punishing victims of abuse, they want you to take the abuse without saying a word. even if you said nothing wrong, you still get punished for replying to harassment. Just how this company works.

Yeah that definitely seems to be the case here unfortunately. I really don't feel as if I was particularly rude to either of the two, and they were simply vulgar and hateful.  But I suppose that's how this game is.

You were banned for the following:

Harassing teammates for the sole reason that they were perceived to be a duo group.
Harassing teammates for the same issue over and over instead of using chat constructively.
Continuously discussing reports (either receiving or giving) during the game.

The combination of these things made the game less enjoyable for other players. Furthermore, it likely wasn't the "duo" that reported you, but someone else on your team, or someone on the other team if you were spamming all chat with these comments.

Your chat does not only negatively affect who it is directed at, it affects the other 4 or 9 people in the game. If you are spamming useless, non-constructive comments, you are not utilizing chat effectively, and you are hurting the game for everyone else in it.

>the Nasus and Hecarim's comments are FAR more disgusting

Their misbehaviour doesn't excuse your own.

>reports don't work unless you do something to get reported for

I love the irony in this.

> [{quoted}](name=Martensitic,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=tozKJEtE,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-05-26T12:05:39.834+0000)
>
> Their misbehaviour doesn't excuse your own.
> 
> I love the irony in this.

I don't expect my "behavior" to be excused provided people can tell me what It is that I said so horribly wrong. Assumed the system would only instantly chat restrict in cases of abuse or downright flaming someone. I had this happen to me, not the other way around, and I still don't think I handled it too poorly.

Yeah it is ironic isn't it.

I still disagree that I was a toxic player here, I still disagree that I deserve a chat restriction for this, and I disagree that calling for a report is "flaming" someone, they deserved to be reported. It feels to me that Riot is intent on punishing anyone who responds to verbal abuse, despite the manner in which the response is given.

However, I appreciate the input.

Are you a Riot employee or just a community member?

Again, your agreement or disagreement is completely irrelevant for the matter at hand. The community, by their report-behavior, teaches the punishment system (which is based on machine learning algorithms) what is okay, and what isn't.

In other words, the community already decided the behavior you have put on display to be punishable, before you wrote these lines into the chat. The reports from your teammates and probably your opponents just triggered the automated chat analysis and subsequent punishment.

I am a community member, riot employees are specifically marked in the boards, they have a "Riot ..." nametag and their posts appear titled in red.

Do you know how reports work?

1 report in a game is the same as 9.

If they are being meanies and trolling, mute and report. Sure, it gets annoying, but be the bigger person and move on.

The answer to verbal abuse is not more toxicity. A wise lesson to learn when playing league.

First of all it only takes one report for a game to be reviewed. Multiple reports foesn't make the system check the game any harder.

Second, the context of the match does not matter. Even if you were going through a tough situation you still made the game worse for the two that weren't involved. You should have just played the game out, not said anything to them and reported them at the end of the game.

> [{quoted}](name=Zezockary,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=tozKJEtE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-05-26T10:26:05.276+0000)
>
> First of all it only takes one report for a game to be reviewed. Multiple reports foesn't make the system check the game any harder.
> 


What is it exactly that they are reviewing for? I was not vulgar, hateful, or abusive to either of them. In fact my only mistake seems to have been taking the bait and continuing to talk back to them. This game was reviewed by their system and my chat log was posted, what particularly in the chat log caused the issue? I'm simply trying to understand WHY I received the disciplinary action when I don't feel I was rude.

Sorry to see yet another person falling to the same trap. Talking back often gets you into trouble, because everyone is responsible for their own behavior.

When you meet negative people like those you describe there is one easy remedy; _mute them, don't talk to them or about them, and report them after the match._ If they start ping spamming you, you have ping mute to use against them these days.

You got away with chat restriction. Live with it and follow the above guideline from now on and you will do fine.
